This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to provide technical support to conservation research and monitoring activities in Ivindo National Park, Gabon, by ensuring that conservation planning tools are used effectively and that project staff possess sufficient capacity and equipment for effective operations. The project will: 1) Ensure that staff possess sufficient capacity and equipment for effective operations. Activities include: employing an experienced Project Management Technical Advisor to build capacity amongst project staff; ensure that personnel management systems are in place; provide necessary field equipment, communication systems and operational resources to implement research and conservation activities; have in place inventory systems and procedures for equipment use and storage; and coordinate short-term work plans. 2) Ensure that all Ivindo Project activities are conducted in accordance with wider ANPN priorities. Activities include: providing input to the Ivindo Conservator on long-term planning tools; and attending regular planning meetings with the National Park Conservator in Makoukou. 3) Develop an international audience for Langoué Bai and Ivindo National Park. Activities include using social media tools to promote the area..

description.narrative: Gabon is an active contributor to conflict resolution and regional security efforts in the Central African region, hosting, and acting as a driving force behind the Economic Community of Central African States, which is establishing a regional standby peacekeeping brigade under the auspices of the African Union's Africa Standby Force. U.S. security assistance to Gabon is aimed at professionalizing the small armed forces (fewer than 8,000 armed service members) by providing training, which will create a force able to operate effectively in regional peacekeeping and maritime security efforts. Gabon has roughly 500 troops participating in U.N peacekeeping efforts in the Central African Republic.
